text: Contribute Contribute Contribute Elsie R Encarnacion 2025 City Council | District 08 Committee To Elect Elsie Encarnacion 2025 $25 $50 $75 $100 $175 NYC resident? With matching funds, your $0.00 contribution can be worth $0.00 . $0.00 $0.00 Go Go All fields are required unless otherwise noted. Apt / Suite / Floor (optional) AK AL AR AS AZ CA CO CT DC DE FL GA GU HI IA ID IL IN KS KY LA MA MD ME MI MN MO MP MS MT NC ND NE NH NJ NM NV NY OH OK OR PA PR RI SC SD TN TX UM UT VA VI VT WA WI WV WY N/A Go If a contributor has business dealings with the City as defined in the Campaign Finance Act, such contributor may give only up to $250 for city council member, $320 for borough president, and $400 for mayor, public advocate or comptroller. Go Rules on Contributions from People Doing Business with the City of New York A “doing business” contributor is a lobbyist, principal owner, principal officer, or senior manager of an entity or firm that presently does business with the City, or within the past 12 months, has done business with the City or has bid or applied for business with the City. Organizations that are “doing business” with the city generally fit one of the following descriptions: Contributors are not considered to be doing business with the City simply because they pay or receive a rebate on City taxes, work for the City, are in a City pension plan, hire a lobbyist, apply for permits for a 1, 2, or 3 family home, drive a City taxi, or apply for street activity permits or other kinds of individual activities with the City. Contributions from or intermediated by persons doing business with the City will not be matched with public funds. For more details or to verify whether you are listed on the Doing Business database, see http://www.nyccfb.info/candidate-services/doing-business-faqs/ All fields are required unless otherwise noted. Apt / Suite / Floor (optional) AK AL AR AS AZ CA CO CT DC DE FL GA GU HI IA ID IL IN KS KY LA MA MD ME MI MN MO MP MS MT NC ND NE NH NJ NM NV NY OH OK OR PA PR RI SC SD TN TX UM UT VA VI VT WA WI WV WY N/A Go Go Although my billing address is different than my home address, the card is paid from my personal funds. Go All fields are required unless otherwise noted. Apt / Suite / Floor (optional) AK AL AR AS AZ CA CO CT DC DE FL GA GU HI IA ID IL IN KS KY LA MA MD ME MI MN MO MP MS MT NC ND NE NH NJ NM NV NY OH OK OR PA PR RI SC SD TN TX UM UT VA VI VT WA WI WV WY N/A Go Please review contributor information below. Click “Back” to change any details. Contribution Amount: Name: Email: Phone: Residential Address: Reason Billing Address is Different: Billing Address: Employment Status: Employer: Occupation: Employer Address: Doing business with NYC: All fields are required. Go Contribution Affirmation By proceeding with this transaction, you (1) agree to this site’s Contribution Rules, Terms and Conditions , and Privacy Policy; (2) authorize the campaign’s payment processor to charge your account for the contribution amount; (3) affirm that the information provided by you is true, complete, and correct to the best of your knowledge and is supplied in good faith; (4) affirm that you are authorized to make this contribution using the credit or debit card information included in your payment instructions; (5) affirm that you are a natural person and not an organization of any kind; and (6) affirm the following statement: I understand that State law requires that a contribution be in my name and be from my own funds. I hereby affirm that I was not, nor, to my knowledge, was anyone else, reimbursed in any manner for this contribution; that this contribution is not being made as a loan; and that this contribution is being made from my personal funds or my personal account, which has no corporate or business affiliation. Council Members each have an office at 250 Broadway , as well as offices in each of their districts. We want to hear from you You can reach us via social media, email, paper mail, or at your district office. For issues specific to a neighborhood, it's best to contact the Council Member representing that community. Have questions, comments or feedback? Email us here. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu ELSIE ENCARNACION: Community Over Competition Building District 8’s Future, Together Fighting for East Harlem and the South Bronx Support Elsie Get Involved Meet Elsie Elsie Encarnacion, a lifelong resident of District 8, has dedicated over a decade to advocating for affordable housing, quality education, and economic empowerment. Driven by the needs of East Harlem and the South Bronx, Elsie’s work centers on uplifting her community, always putting people before politics. Learn More Community-Centric Impact Through her roles as Chief of Staff to Deputy Speaker Diana Ayala and Director of Youth Services to City Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito, Elsie remains committed to creating real change. Her initiative, ‘Community Over Competition,’ embodies her belief in putting community voices first, ensuring they guide every decision. “Engagement has always been the foundation of my work. Our future lies in the strength of our community and the power of collaboration.” Elsie Encarnacion Join Elsie on this journey to uplift District 8. Together, we can create a brighter future for East Harlem and the South Bronx. Her initiative, ‘Community Over Competition,’ embodies her belief in putting community voices first, ensuring they guide every decision. “Engagement has always been the foundation of my work. Our future lies in the strength of our community and the power of collaboration.” Elsie Encarnacion Join Elsie on this journey to uplift District 8. Together, we can create a brighter future for East Harlem and the South Bronx. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu Creating a Stronger District 8, Together Elsie’s Vision for District 8 Housing With over eight years of council experience and her work as the chair of the land use committee of Community Board 11, Elsie brings a comprehensive understanding of housing and housing affordability. Elsie not only recognizes, but firmly believes, that it is essential to protect vulnerable populations from displacement which fosters stable communities and promotes social equity. Elsie aims to create sustainable solutions that contribute to long-term community stability and resilience while enhancing the quality of life for all residents by: Supporting deep affordability in development projects Ensuring that housing remains accessible to all income levels Providing funding and advocating for projects that align with the specific community needs Acknowledging that wages, cultural institutions, and local businesses all play a vital role in the housing ecosystem Youth & Education Understanding the significant challenges facing the education system, Elsie is prepared to unite families, educators, and advocates to battle for the highest-quality education possible. With 11 years of impactful experience in education, Elsie is fiercely dedicated to creating opportunities for young people, placing youth development at the forefront of her priorities. Her impact includes: Mentored countless youth, fostering their growth and leadership skills Lead initiatives such as youth councils, which she plans to reinstate if elected to the council Developed a platform to combat youth violence Advocating and securing increased funding for youth programs that stimulate workforce development opportunities Led the charge in revitalizing participatory budgeting in the district, with a specific focus on schools. Dedicating 2 Million dollars to Capital funding for schools in District 8. Elsie's extensive experience with youth highlights her genuine commitment to making a difference. Small Business & Economic Development Small businesses are truly the heart and soul of our community; recognizing the vital role they play in creating jobs and providing essential services. Elsie believes in creating an environment where businesses can thrive. In her current role Elsie has: Supported street clean-ups which help keep our corridors clean Advocated for investments in lighting and safety that contribute to a welcoming atmosphere for both residents and visitors. Participated in the process of creating the 125th Street Business Improvement District (BID). Worked alongside SBS to create job fairs, resume writing workshops and small business development fairs. Her vision is clear: she aims to keep infusing resources into programs that strengthen our local economy and help it flourish. But Elsie's commitment doesn't end with small businesses; she is also passionate about opening doors for our youths' economic growth and advocates for equitable wages aiming to create real pathways for young people as they enter the job market. With her unwavering dedication to both local businesses and youth empowerment, Elsie is determined to make a lasting impact on the economic landscape of our community. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu About Elsie Encarnacion Elsie Encarnacion, born and raised in East Harlem, has spent over a decade working tirelessly for District 8. As the daughter of a public school educator and a product of the local public schools, she knows firsthand the value of education, opportunity, and community support. A Champion for District 8 Experience and Impact Over her career, Elsie has fought to bring essential resources to East Harlem and the South Bronx. Her tenure as Chief of Staff to Deputy Speaker Diana Ayala, along with her previous roles in education and community organizing, prepared her to lead with heart and purpose. Her leadership on Community Board 11, Union Settlement, and Innovation High School, among others, highlights her commitment to building a strong, resilient District 8. Core Values: Community Over Competition Elsie’s work is rooted in her core belief of ‘ Community Over Competition. ’ For her, every policy and program must serve the people first. Elsie understands the challenges of poverty in our district and is determined to tackle them head-on. She is passionate about youth development, economic growth, and fighting for fairness for everyone. By focusing on key community needs and working together with others, she believes we can create real opportunities and ease the worries many people have about being left behind. Elsie stands on the shoulders of those who came before her, and with her strong dedication and approachable leadership, she is committed to making lasting, positive changes that benefit us all. Join the Movement Join Elsie’s journey to bring positive change to District 8. Together, we can create a thriving, united community.
